meanings.definition: To grow again after being cut or damaged.
meanings.sent1: The plant will regrow its leaves after they were trimmed.
meanings.sent2: If you trim the bushes, they will regrow thicker and healthier.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally cut the flowers, but luckily they can regrow.
meanings.sent4: Like a phoenix from the ashes, the tree will regrow its branches.
meanings.sent5: After the fire, the forest began to regrow, showing resilience.

meanings.sent1: The grass will regrow in the spring after the winter frost.
meanings.sent2: If you plant new seeds, they will regrow into beautiful flowers.
meanings.sent3: I forgot to water the plant, but it managed to regrow with some sunlight.
meanings.sent4: Just like a fresh start, the garden will regrow with care and attention.
meanings.sent5: The memories may fade, but hope can regrow like a blooming flower.
